paper_title.ja: 多言語背景の年少者用漢字テストの作成
paper_title.en: 多言語背景の年少者用漢字テストの作成

description.ja: 多言語で育った年少者を対象とした日本語力の測定の一つとして漢字テストの開発を進めている。本稿では海外で日本語を学ぶ年少者の教育，特に米国日本語補習校の児童・生徒の漢字学習の実体について述べ，その後，開発した年少者用漢字テストについて紹介する。今回紹介するテストは，文部科学省の学年別配当漢字に沿って，漢字の読み書き，意味的処理および文脈的処理問題の内容から構成し，内容ごとに各学年で同じ問題数とした。
description.en: 多言語で育った年少者を対象とした日本語力の測定の一つとして漢字テストの開発を進めている。本稿では海外で日本語を学ぶ年少者の教育，特に米国日本語補習校の児童・生徒の漢字学習の実体について述べ，その後，開発した年少者用漢字テストについて紹介する。今回紹介するテストは，文部科学省の学年別配当漢字に沿って，漢字の読み書き，意味的処理および文脈的処理問題の内容から構成し，内容ごとに各学年で同じ問題数とした。

paper_title.ja: プレースメントテストにおける中上級「漢字SPOT」の項目分析 : 漢字圏・韓国・非漢字圏受験者の比較を通して
paper_title.en: Item analysis of advanced level Kanji SPOT for placement test : Comparing the results of learners with different Kanji background

description.ja: This study analyzes the advanced level "Kanji SPOT" placement test results of 260 Japanese language learners. These learners are divided into three groups: learners with Kanji knowledge background, Korean background, and non-Kanji background. The test results are compared and analyzed among the three groups for their item difficulty, item discrimination, Kanji discerning abilities, and the influences of the First Language.
description.en: This study analyzes the advanced level "Kanji SPOT" placement test results of 260 Japanese language learners. These learners are divided into three groups: learners with Kanji knowledge background, Korean background, and non-Kanji background. The test results are compared and analyzed among the three groups for their item difficulty, item discrimination, Kanji discerning abilities, and the influences of the First Language.

paper_title.ja: 上級日本語学習者向けSPOT(Simple Performance-Oriented Test)の開発
paper_title.en: Development of SPOT for advanced level learners of Japanese

description.ja: SPOT is a gap-filling test which requires test takers to listen to an audio tape consisting of 60 isolated sentences and to fill in the blank on an answer sheet, each with a single hiragana character. However, as the former SPOT A-B was found not to be able to distinguish the proficiency between advanced and superior learners, we challenged making the Trial SPOT with high degree of difficulty for the purpose of examining learners' proficiency more exactly. This trial test contains of advanced grammatical items and also every question was read by two native speakers in high speed. This paper discusses the overview of the trial SPOT and the comparison of the test results administered to 50 advanced level learners and 50 Japanese native speakers.
description.en: SPOT is a gap-filling test which requires test takers to listen to an audio tape consisting of 60 isolated sentences and to fill in the blank on an answer sheet, each with a single hiragana character. However, as the former SPOT A-B was found not to be able to distinguish the proficiency between advanced and superior learners, we challenged making the Trial SPOT with high degree of difficulty for the purpose of examining learners' proficiency more exactly. This trial test contains of advanced grammatical items and also every question was read by two native speakers in high speed. This paper discusses the overview of the trial SPOT and the comparison of the test results administered to 50 advanced level learners and 50 Japanese native speakers.
